mdRecord.dcterms:title: U.S. Army first aid packet
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Bauer & Black [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: An unopened World War I first aid packet marked "FIRST AID PACKET - U.S. ARMY, CONTRACT NOV. 2 - 1916, BAUER & BLACK, CHICAGO, U.S.A., TO OPEN - PULL RING, PATENT APPLIED FOR." The kit was retained by Dr. Percy Elisha Duggins (1890-1965), a 1913 graduate of the UVA School of Medicine.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: World War, 1914-1918--First aid in illness and injury
